en:
Eunomia (labelled), standing 3/4-view to the right, with her weight on
      her left leg, wearing a peplos, a short pony tail, and black hoop earrings surrounded by wisps
      of hair, rests her right hand on her hip, and a string of beads in her lowered left hand; nude
      Apollo (labelled), seated 3/4-view to the right on drapery on a rock (?), raises his right
      foot on a low rock, and turns his head profile to the left, wearing an olive wreath, rests his
      right hand on a rock, and his left elbow on his left thigh, holds a long olive branch that
      rests on the inside of his left leg, and on his left shoulder; Eukleia (labelled), standing
      near profile to the left, wearing a belted peplos, a high pony tail, and black hoop earrings,
      raises her right foot on a high rock, and places her left hand on her right knee, and holds in
      her right hand a white garland toward Apollo.

B. Caprez-Csornay, "The Andrs Alfldi Collection," <hi rend="ital">Museum of
      Fine Arts, Budapest. Newsletter</hi> (undated); <bibl>Shapiro 1993</bibl>,
      74-75, 235 no. 23, figs. 26-27; <bibl>Add2</bibl>, 364; <bibl>Boardman
      1989a</bibl>, fig. 301; <bibl>LIMC</bibl>, 4.49 s.v. Eukleia no. 2, pl. 22
      (A. Kossatz-Deissmann), 64 s.v. Eunomia no. 10 (A. Kossatz-Deissmann); I. Wehgartner, "Das
      Ideal massvoller Liebe auf einem attischen Vasenbild. Neues zur Lekythos F 2705 im Berliner
      Antikenmuseum," <hi rend="ital">JdI</hi> 102 (1987) 195 fig. 8;
      <bibl>LIMC</bibl>, 2.274 s.v. Apollon no. 733 (B. Lambrinudakis et al.); D.
      Cramers and E. Simon, "Ein neues Werk des Meidiasmalers," <hi rend="ital">AA</hi>
      1978, 71 n. 8; J.G. Szilgyi and M. Szbo, Antik Killts (Budapest 1974) 51-52 fig. 31;
      <bibl>Hamdorf 1964</bibl> 111 no. 440f; <bibl>Hampe 1955</bibl>, 120g,
      121; <bibl>Mtzger 1951</bibl>, 19; <bibl>Schefold 1937</bibl>, 63,
      71-72, figs. 20-23
